title: Thousands march in Hungary in protest over child abuse scandal

description: The verdicts are believed to be indicative of the way the political wind is blowing in the State ahead of the Assembly polls. However, experts point to the case of 2010 local body polls, when a good showing in the district panchayats, did not exactly reflect in the subsequent Assembly election. LDF and UDF share 7 district panchayats this time.

description: West Bengal governor C V Ananda Bose was denied entry to Salt Lake stadium after chaos erupted during a Lionel Messi event. He deemed the incident an affront to his constitutional office and sought an explanation, vowing to inspect the site to finalize his report. The Governor also demanded accountability for the mismanagement and police failures.

title: UK police won’t probe claim former prince asked bodyguard to investigate Virginia Giuffre
8th Pay Commission: Railways to trim costs; maintenance, procurement, energy sectors in focus
description: Indian Railways is implementing significant cost-cutting measures in maintenance, procurement, and energy to bolster its finances. This proactive approach aims to absorb anticipated wage increases from the Eighth Pay Commission, projected to be substantial. The railway is focusing on operational efficiency and increased freight revenue to manage the financial impact.

description: In central Syria an ISIS gunman ambushed US forces near Palmyra, claiming the lives of two American service members and one civilian. Three other troops sustained injuries in the attack. The gunman was neutralized by forces. This incident marks the first US casualties in Syria since a significant political shift a year ago.

title: Philippines says fishermen hurt, boats damaged by China in South China Sea
description: On Friday, China’s coast guard said it had driven away multiple Philippine vessels and taken “control measures”

Sudan war: Terrorists attack UN base; 6 killed
description: A deadly drone strike on a UN facility in Sudan's South Kordofan region has claimed at least six lives, according to a medical source. The attack, which eyewitnesses attribute to a drone, occurred in Kadugli, a city facing severe humanitarian crises. Sudan's government has condemned the incident, accusing the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) of responsibility.

description: Lionel Messi's GOAT India Tour proceeded smoothly in Hyderabad after a chaotic start in Kolkata. The Argentine star participated in a penalty shootout and football clinics for children, receiving a warm welcome from fans and dignitaries. Messi will continue his tour in Mumbai and conclude in New Delhi with a meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: Woman, two sons found dead in Kalkaji home; suicide note reveals financial woes
description: A tragic discovery in Kalkaji, Delhi, where a 52-year-old woman and her two sons were found deceased. Police suspect suicide, citing an alleged note that points to severe financial and personal struggles. The family's dire situation, including unpaid rent and unemployment, may have led to this heartbreaking outcome. Investigations are ongoing.

title: CM, leaders all praise for Horatti, Chairman of Council felicitated for completing 45 years as MLC
description: Chairman of Karnataka Legislative Council Basavaraj Horatti, who has already created a record for his eighth successive win from teachers’ constituency, was given a grand and warm felicitation by leaders of various political parties including chief minister Siddaramaiah at Nehru Stadium in Hubballi on Saturday in the presence of thousands of teachers and well wishers from different walks of life.

Sittilingi: a tribal valley’s inspiring success story
description: In Sittilingi, a valley in western Tamil Nadu, the infant mortality rate in the early 1990s was 147 babies for every 1,000 births. Today, it stands at eight. In the intervening years, the one factor that changed local dynamics and improved healthcare and general standards of living in this largely tribal belt was the involvement of a doctor couple and their dedicated team. An ear firmly invested in listening to the community’s needs, coupled with a desire to bring about positive change, has turned Sittilingi into a vastly different place today

title: Anakapalli man ‘kills’ father-in-law for insurance payout of ₹1 crore
description: Caught in a debt trap of ₹30 lakh, Annavaram, on the advice of an insurance agent, purchased seven policies in the name of the victim first and planned the murder over two years

description: A powerful explosion near the Indian Navy's ammunition storage facility in Uttara Kannada district caused significant alarm, with over 30 houses developing cracks and windows rattling in nearby villages. Residents described the blast as deafening, prompting immediate damage assessment by local authorities. The exact cause and origin of the incident remain unconfirmed.

Biggest IPO ever? Insider share sale sets SpaceX valuation at $800 bn
description: SpaceX is reportedly conducting an internal share sale valuing the company at $800 billion, with a potential 2026 IPO in the works. This valuation, nearly double its previous figure, surpasses OpenAI's record and positions SpaceX as the world's most valuable private firm. Funds will fuel Starship development, AI data centers, and lunar base initiatives.

WB sports minister reacts to chaos during Messi's visit - 'I will not ...'
description: West Bengal Sports Minister Aroop Biswas announced an investigation into the chaotic events at Salt Lake Stadium during Lionel Messi's GOAT Tour. Fans reacted with disappointment and unrest after Messi's early departure, leading to property damage and police intervention. The All India Football Federation clarified its non-involvement in the privately organized event.

title: 'Cannot bulldoze court': CBI counters Rabri Devi: opposes transfer of cases
description: The CBI opposed Rabri Devi's plea to transfer criminal cases, arguing it constitutes "forum-shopping" and aims to demean the judge. The agency stated that Special Judge Vishal Gogne acted within judicial procedures and that the application seeks to stall the trial. The court will hear the matter further on December 15, 2025.

title: Akhlaq lynching case: Left seeks Prez's intervention; UP govt moves to withdraw case
description: CPI(M) leader Brinda Karat has urged President Murmu to intervene against the Uttar Pradesh government's move to withdraw charges in the 2015 Dadri mob lynching of Mohammad Akhlaq. Karat termed the governor's approval of the withdrawal a "politically motivated" attempt to subvert justice, questioning the governor's constitutional duty to uphold the rule of law.

title: ‘You can’t catch me acting’: Salman Khan admits he struggles with acting, fans disagree
Gas chamber: GRAP 3 fails, strictest curbs now in force in Delhi; what's restricted
description: Delhi-NCR faces emergency curbs as air quality plummets to 'Severe+' levels, triggering Stage IV of the Graded Response Action Plan. Authorities have enforced strict restrictions across the region due to pollution crossing critical thresholds. This comes after the city's Air Quality Index surged overnight, leading to dense smog and reduced visibility, impacting public health.

title: Imran Khan’s ex-wife Jemima Goldsmith’s ‘personal plea’ to Elon Musk over her X posts

This follows a dinner meeting hosted by Shivakumar with over 30 legislators and ministers, fueling speculation about a leadership transition pact made after the 2023 election victory.

description: A 17-year-old boy, nephew of former Jalandhar West MLA Sheetal Angural, was fatally stabbed in Jalandhar. The victim, Vikas Angural, was attacked by a man identified as Kalu and accomplices. The former MLA alleges the main accused is a drug peddler, highlighting the area's drug problem. Police are investigating the incident.

description: GST reforms are projected to reduce retail inflation by up to 35 basis points in 2025-26, with an estimated 25 basis points decline already observed between September and November 2025 due to rate adjustments. While Kerala faces higher inflation driven by specific commodity prices, national CPI is expected to average 1.8% in 2025-26.

The team also seeks a frontline Indian spinner and a pace bowling addition to complete their balanced XI.

This confrontation highlights ongoing scrutiny of England's tour preparations as they trail 0-2 in the series.

2001 Parliament attack: When terror from 'sarhad' struck Sansad
description: Terrorists attacked India's Parliament on December 13, 2001. This event brought the threat of terrorism to the nation's core. Security forces bravely fought back, preventing a greater crisis. The attack reshaped India's security architecture, leading to enhanced surveillance and intelligence sharing. It remains a critical moment in India's fight against terrorism.

title: 'Goldilocks' economy: India in a rare 'sweet spot'; do you stand to gain?
description: India is experiencing a rare economic phase with near-zero inflation and robust growth exceeding 8%. While this 'Goldilocks' moment benefits borrowers and large corporations, farmers face significant losses due to falling food prices. Savers might see reduced returns as interest rates decline, highlighting a complex economic landscape where benefits are unevenly distributed.

The notice demands a public apology and Rs 10 lakh compensation for the alleged malicious use of her picture during a protest. The committee claims the usage was unintentional.

title: David and Victoria Beckham net worth 2025: Football, fashion, business
description: Power couple David and Victoria Beckham boast a combined net worth of $900 million in 2025. David's fortune stems from his legendary football career and lucrative endorsements, while Victoria built hers through successful fashion and beauty empires.  Together, they manage valuable brands, support their family, and remain influential figures in global sports and fashion.

title: Climate migration begins: Tuvaluans relocate to Australia; special visas take effect
description: Australia has welcomed the first climate migrants from Tuvalu, a Pacific nation facing inundation due to rising sea levels. A groundbreaking bilateral treaty allows Tuvaluans to live, study, and work in Australia, offering "mobility with dignity" as climate impacts worsen. This initiative marks a significant step in addressing climate-induced displacement.

title: AI browser battle: Google unveils Disco; Highlights gaps in OpenAI’s Atlas
description: Google unveils Disco, an experimental browser that transforms browsing activity into custom web applications using its Gemini 3 AI. This  approach, powered by GenTabs, directly challenges AI browsers like OpenAI's Atlas by building apps rather than just adding chatbots.  Disco aims to redefine browser functionality with AI at its core, offering a glimpse into the future of web navigation.

title: Brittany Mahomes breaks silence with yellow post as Patrick faces tough week
description: Following a tough 20-10 loss to the Texans, Brittany Mahomes' game-day fashion took center stage. Her striking yellow coat, shared with a simple emoji caption and turned-off comments, became a symbol of hope and quiet strength amidst the Kansas City Chiefs' challenging season. This subtle display offered a message of support and resilience.

title: Who Is Paige Shiver? Why her name surfaced in the Sherrone Moore controversy
Nick Fuentes warns he’ll expose Candace Owens if TPUSA livestream fails
description: Nick Fuentes has issued a stern warning to Turning Point USA, threatening to expose Candace Owens if their December 15 livestream fails to adequately address her unproven claims about Charlie Kirk's death. Fuentes stated he will livestream his own exposé, naming names and providing evidence, if TPUSA does not handle the situation properly.

title: Meet your teeth’s invisible shield: Why enamel care matters most
description: Many Indians are unknowingly risking their teeth's natural shield, enamel, due to common habits like harsh brushing and acidic diets. This vital outer layer, crucial for preventing cavities and sensitivity, cannot regenerate once worn down.
